TopicTitle: Squad, WHAT DID YOU DO TO THEM?

Articles.Content:
So I was playing around in the asteroid capture scenario, and I accidentally clicked the tab for the Final Frontier mod. There, I noticed that Bob and Jeb's status was red, instead of the blue and green I'd seen. I moused over to see what it meant, and got this:

What happened in the making of this scenario!?

um ... that's a mod... so... squad didn't do anything?

I'm confused. What are you asking?

um ... that's a mod... so... squad didn't do anything?

I'm confused. What are you asking?

It means that earlier in the save they died.

yeah... and?

Depending on your settings they can be perma dead, temporarily dead, or return immediately. Been like that for a while now...

yeah... and?

Depending on your settings they can be perma dead, temporarily dead, or return immediately. Been like that for a while now...

FF is set to permadead, which is why they were still dead when the pic was taken. This is irrelevant, and you're missing the point. They died in the making of the scenario. Squad did some screwing around before submitting.
Ahhh I see, the offical asteroid capture scenario.
You're making a mountain out of a mole hill. It's most likely a bug in the game, besides Biil, Bob and Jeb aren't affected by perma death in stock so it was most likely dismissed of known.

You're making a mountain out of a mole hill. It's most likely a bug in the game, besides Biil, Bob and Jeb aren't affected by perma death in stock so it was most likely dismissed of known.

He's using a mod to perma-death...

And I doubt it was a bug. Devs probably slamed a kerbal into an asteroid
They might have just terminated some unnecessary spaceships before saving the scenario.

You're making a mountain out of a mole hill

Actually I think he's trying to crack a joke

He's using a mod to perma-death...

And I doubt it was a bug. Devs probably slamed a kerbal into an asteroid

I mean a bug that killed them in the first place. Not the perma death part.

You're making a mountain out of a mole hill.

Seems more like making a moon out of an asteroid to me.

Seems more like making a moon out of an asteroid to me.

That's no moon.

Actually I think he's trying to crack a joke

I was facepalming all the way to this comment, thinking I was the only one who got it
